13,http://www.armslist.com/posts/3409013,For Trade:  FT/ LNIB Glock 20 Gen4 10mm + extras,"Yukon, Oklahoma City, Oklahoma",Offer,"Listed On: Wednesday, August 20, 2014",Handguns,Glock                                                                                ,10mm                                                                                ,Striker Fire,no type,"Hi, up for trade is an LNIB, Glock 20 gen4 with TTI Competition/Combat sights (uninstalled and unopened), VTSS (Vickers Tactical Slide Stop), VTMR (Vickers Tactical Magazine Release),  DPM Recoil System (mechanical recoil reduction guide rod system. Makes for an extremely soft shooting 10mm), tree bark stipple, 3 mags, box, papers, spent casing, range bag ect...
Plus comes with 220rds of 10mm ammunition as follows:
150rds of Remington 180gr FMJ
50rds of PMC 170gr JHP
20rds of Cor-Bon 135gr JHP

Also comes with original factory slide stop, mag release, and factory guide rod. I have not had the time to install the TTI sights yet, however, in my opinion, they are the best competition sights on the market! Much better than Dawson! The DPM System is about the best guide rod you can buy on the market. It significantly reduces recoil, gives better control and accuracy, superior slide and frame protection, improved firing speed, elimination of jams and much more!"

FROM THE MANUFACTURER:

Sure as autumn arrives, the Model 870™ Wingmaster® rises to meet another day in the upland fields and woods of America. The Model 870 is so smooth and reliable that today – nearly 60 years after its introduction – it’s still the standard by which all pump shotguns are measured. With a receiver machined from a solid billet of steel, it is the model of enduring strength. True to its original design, the pump glides with silky surety on two twin action bars for the utmost in positive chambering and ejection. These characteristics, along with its flawless balance and natural pointing qualities have made the Model 870 the best-selling, most trusted shotgun of all time – of any action type, from any manufacturer. As the most aesthetically refined representative of our prestigious pump-action family, the Model 870 Wingmaster is a true American icon.

Available in 12 gauge 2 3/4"" and 3"", 20 and 28 gauge, and .410 bore, it has a custom-quality finish and handsome American walnut woodwork. The receiver and barrel are richly blued and highly polished for classic appeal. We also offer a broad selection of barrel and choke options to fit your application.
Key Features:
Remarkable reliability and durability
The smoothest pump action shotgun on the market
Superior balance, handling and looks
Points, swings and functions better than anything else in its class
The highly polished and richly blued receiver is milled from a solid billet of steel for the ultimate in rugged dependability
A wide array of barrel and choke options make versatility a Wingmaster® hallmark
Twin-action bars for non-binding action
Available in standard 12 gauge 2 3/4"" and 3"", 20, 28 gauge and .410 bore"

654,http://www.armslist.com/posts/3409654,For Sale:  WWI COLT “BLACK ARMY” 1911,"JOLIET AREA, Chicago, Illinois","$ 2,100","Listed On: Friday, October 10, 2014",Handguns,Colt                                                                                ,45 ACP                                                                                ,Single Action                                                                                ,Pistol,"Up for sale is an all-original Colt Black Army 1911 made in 1918 and will be a hundred years old in four years.  Excellent condition and fully functional, comes with one magazine and an original 1918 dated US holster.

The ""Black Army"" is a collectors designation for mid to late 1918 Colt 1911 production. In order to speed production for the war effort, Colt left off some final polishing steps that produced a dark - almost black finish.  From the black finish the pistol became known as the ""Black Army"" almost as if it was a model variation produced by Colt.  Black Armies are not uncommon but difficult to find in this condition.
These came with 3 different types of grips, diamond and checkered (most common), checkered as pictured here and plain.
Joliet Area, all Illinois laws apply, more pics available on request."

Born of the traditions of the Old West, the Rough Rider maintains much of the look and feel of the legendary Single Action Army revolver, only in a scaled down version. Chambered for the .22LR and .22 Magnum cartridges, the Rough Rider is manufactured using state-of-the-art precision machinery that assures its accuracy and reliability. The cylinder lock-up is tight and the perfect timing of the action makes for a handgun that will put its shots where you want 'em.

The machined barrel is micro-threaded and inserted into the frame for the optimal barrel/cylinder gap to give you maximum ammunition performance. A hammer block mounted in the recoil shield provides extra protection and has a red dot indicator that lets you know when the gun is ready for action. A new, more authentic looking flat-sided hammer paired with new exotic cocobolo grips, makes the Rough Rider both functional and handsome. There are also other grip materials available, plus finish options include the attractive and durable Smooth Silver Satin. When it comes to the Rough Rider there are no shortcuts taken!
Ideal for hunting, plinking or western action shooting, let the Rough Rider be your choice in a new rimfire revolver.

978,http://www.armslist.com/posts/3409978,For Sale:  Converted Saiga 12 Semi-Auto Shotgun,"South West Suburbs, Chicago, Illinois","$ 1,300","Listed On: Friday, September 5, 2014",Shotguns,Saiga                                                                                ,12 Gauge                                                                                ,Semi-automatic                                                                                ,Shotgun,"Up for sale is a converted IZHMASH Saiga-12 Shotgun. Gently used, with less than 100 rounds through her. Grey Cerakote paint. This gun has been converted with the following features. Gas port mod, piston mod, Carolina Shooters supply trigger guard, Tapco trigger group, ATI rubber textured hand grip. The stock is a Phoenix Technologies shock absorbing collapsible. Toward the front, I have installed the CHAOS SAIGA 12 EXTENDED TITAN QUAD RAIL. This thing is a beast, its not only beautiful and finely machined, but adds a very solid feel to the shotgun. There is a Blackhawk vertical grip on the front end, that can also be extended with the additional part that I have with it. Right now i have it in the ""stubby"" configuration, but if you like you can make that a bit longer. On the front I have a Kineti-Tech Barrel shroud. This just makes the gun look that much cooler. It is easily removed, if you prefer to have it off the gun. It does add a little bit of weight to the front, but it is not bad. I do also have the thread protector ring just in case you choose to go without the shroud. The gun comes with a 5 round and an 8 round magazine. The stock cleaning kit is also here, although i haven't used it. There is also a cleaning rod. I did attach a red dot style site on the top rail (as you can see in the pic), but it is not up to par with the recoil of this gun. The site jitters out of position after a few shots, and needs to be re adjusted. Im just sending it with the gun. This gun also comes with a hard case. So if you buy this gun, you will have everything you need except the ammo.

Keep in mind, this firearm has been truly converted, not like others who state it is converted but did not move the trigger group and guard forward to its original intended position that IZHMASH designed. They sell stocks with the built in pistol grip to make it look like it is converted, but in reality the trigger group is still in the rearward position with a mechanical linkage to the hammer.  Just an FYI for those that aren't aware of the difference between a converted and non converted saiga 12.
As per IL law, I am required to perform a FOID check with the govt., so please do not ask me to sell this to you without following the law.
Thank you"
